ratings.question_text: I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: What is the name of your TA?
Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: This course was a 10 day silviculture and forest management workshop in the Bavarian Region of Germany. Most of the above questions are not applicable. It was a great time. We learned a lot about Bavarian silvicultre and the trip was well run.
This was an incredibly valuable trip, which touched on all the concpets we have learned at FES. Richard and Britta did a fantastic job running the show.
Instructor with passion for the subject and incomparable dedication to his students.Examples drawn from all over the world--instructor doesn't shy away from the complicated tropics!
The learning of German forest management. The city tours. The involvement of the German students. The dinners out. The hike in the national park.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: I know most of the students taking the class are not planning to become field foresters, but more emphasis on the quantitative side of silviculture would have been useful. Memorizing tables would not have been helpful, but exercises using tables provided in texts or from case studies would have left me with more confidence in analyzing a silvicultural scenario, and would have made it easier to write a more substantive term paper.

Students ought to meet before the trip to go over German nuances as it pertains to foreigners. For example, how does one order a beer and what does each beer name mean. Like for the Southern field trip, students should give a presentation on the different aspects of culture, history, and forestry so they will have a greater appreciation for the country and the forestry once they are there.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: Generally quite good but their quantitative expertise could have been greater.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: This course is a fundamental part of my MF program.
I have an interest in international relations among the forestry community.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: It was a good opportunity to travel and experience another culture. To broaden my forestry knowledge.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
Did you get out of it what you expected?
If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: It was great working with some of the German students.

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Learn some phrases in German. Do not be shy around the Germans. They speak English and want to practice with you. Do not be cliquey with your FES buddys. Branch out, as this is the perfect opportunity to build international relations.
